abstracts

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • abstracts.Level

  • public abstract class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all the basics that a level should contain.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Level(QGame game)
      Game must be given to the level so that the level knows parameters such as screen size and all.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void delete()
      Remove all the variables here.
      abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Draw everything needed here.
      QGame getGame()
      Returns the game that this level is attached to.
      boolean isActive()
      If the current level is active and is being used.
      boolean isLoaded()
      Tells you if the current level resources are loaded.
      abstract void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      All the keyboard presses will be registered here.
      abstract void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      All the keyboard releases will be registered here.
      abstract void load()
      Load all of your images and sounds and such here.
      abstract void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      If mouse has entered into the window.
      abstract void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Mouse movement actions will go here.
      abstract void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      If user presses the mouse button.
      void setActive(boolean active)
      Sets the status of the current level.
      void setLoaded(boolean loaded)
      Sets the loaded status of the game to what you give it.
      abstract void setup()
      Setup all of your variables here, however do not load them here.
      abstract void update()
      This will be called in parallel with draw.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(QGame game)
        Game must be given to the level so that the level knows parameters such as screen size and all.
        Parameters:
        game - the game in which this level will be present.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        If the current level is active and is being used.
        Returns:
        Status of the current level.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)
        Sets the status of the current level.
        Parameters:
        active - status of the current level. True means active and false means inactive.

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded()
        Tells you if the current level resources are loaded. If not then I would suggest using load before setting loaded to true.
        Returns:
        True if resources are loaded, false otherwise.

      • setLoaded

        public void setLoaded(boolean loaded)
        Sets the loaded status of the game to what you give it. Should be private and should be used at the end of the load method, however I am leaving this public for experimentation.
        Parameters:
        loaded - status of the level's resources. Set to true if resources are loaded, false otherwise.

      • getGame

        public QGame getGame()
        Returns the game that this level is attached to. This will be used in the child classes that extend this class.
        Returns:
        QGame that this level is attached to.

      • setup

        public abstract void setup()
        Setup all of your variables here, however do not load them here.

      • load

        public abstract void load()
        Load all of your images and sounds and such here.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draw everything needed here.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics to which to draw images to.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        This will be called in parallel with draw. Do all your collision logic and such in here.

      • keyPressed

        public abstract void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        All the keyboard presses will be registered here.
        Parameters:
        e - What key the user has pressed.

      • keyReleased

        public abstract void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        All the keyboard releases will be registered here.
        Parameters:
        e - Which key the user has released.

      • mouseEntered

        public abstract void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If mouse has entered into the window. Quite useless but I am giving this lesson nonetheless.
        Parameters:
        e - Event which shows where the mouse has entered.

      • mousePressed

        public abstract void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If user presses the mouse button.
        Parameters:
        e - All the info about which mouse button was pressed and where.

      • mouseMoved

        public abstract void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Mouse movement actions will go here.
        Parameters:
        e - Where the mouse is currently located.

      • delete

        public abstract void delete()
        Remove all the variables here. And make sure to set everything to null so that level can be deleted and done with.
